Description: PROJECT TITLE: LIDAR ACQUISITION FLIGHT FOR SOLANO COUNTY REGIONAL GIS CONSORTIUMPROJECT PERIOD: JUNE 29, 2023 - JUNE 30, 2025PROJECT ABSTRACT:SOLANO COUNTY IS IN NEED OF A QL1 LIDAR DATA COLLECTION WHICH HAS NEVER BEEN DONE BEFORE. THERE WERE TWO PREVIOUS QL2 COLLECTIONS IN 2017 AND 2018 BUT NEVER THE ENTIRE COUNTY AT ONE TIME AT QL1 DATA DENSITY. THE COUNTY HAS SEVERAL HAZARDS THAT CAN BE MONITORED VIA LIDAR GIVEN THE RECURRING INCIDENTS OF FIRE AND THE GROUNDWATER MANAGEMENT EFFORTS THAT HAVE BEEN PRIORITIZED DUE TO INTENSE DROUGHT CONDITIONS. THERE HAS ALSO BEEN SIGNIFICANT DEVELOPMENT IN THE COUNTY IN THE LAST DECADE WITH A NOTABLE INCREASE IN THE POPLUATION. THE IMPORTANCE OF THIS DATA TO POTENTIAL LAND SLIDE DETECTION, WATER-WAY MANAGEMENT, PERMITTING, MITIGATION PLANNING, EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL DECISIONS IS CRITICAL. SOLANO COUNTY HAS BEEN PROACTIVE ABOUT SHARING GIS DATA TO THE PUBLIC AND REGIONAL INTERESTS FOR YEARS WHICH HAS BENEFITTED THE REGION WITH AUTHORITATIVE DATA AND A COST SHARING MECHANISM BY WAY OF A REGIONAL GIS CONSORTIUM (REGIS). REGIS SUPPORTS THE AGGREGATION OF MANY SMALLER FUNDING POCKETS INTO A FUND MANAGED BY SOLANO COUNTY INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY DEPARTMENT TO PURCHASE AERIAL IMAGERY AND LIDAR PRODUCTS UNDER A MASTER DATA SHARING AGREEMENT WITH THE 14 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE REGIS SIGNATORIES.SOLANO COUNTY REGIS WILL BE FLYING A COMPLETE COUNTYWIDE QL1 LIDAR FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER. THE COMPREHENSIVE DATA CAPTURING FOUR TIMES AS MUCH DATA AS QL2 WILL PROVIDE THE RICH CONTEXT NEEDED TO ASSESS SOLANO COUNTY WHICH IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT GIVEN THE HIGH RISK OF FIRES AND THE DROUGHT CONDITIONS IMPACTING THE WATER SOURCES IN THE COUNTY. LIDAR DATA WILL PROVIDE RESIDENTS, PLANNERS, ENGINEERS, PUBLIC SAFETY PERSONNEL AND OTHERS WITH A VALUABLE TOOL FOR RECOGNIZING AND COMMUNICATING RISKS AND MITIGATION ACTIONS.SOLANO COUNTY HAS SELECTED SANBORN AS THE VENDOR FOR ACQUIRING AND PERFORMING QUALITY ASSURANCE OF LIDAR DATA. SANBORN HAS YEARS OF EXPERIENCE CREATING AND DESIGNING DATA FOR LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL RESOURCES THAT MEET OR EXCEED ALL APPLICABLE STANDARDS FOR CARTOGRAPHIC PRODUCTS. THEIR TECHNICAL APPROACH FOR THE METHODOLOGY TO COLLECT AIRBORNE LIDAR DATA, LIDAR POINT CLOUD CLASSIFICATION AND THE GENERATION OF DERIVATIVE DATA PRODUCTS IS SECOND TO NONE. SANBORN WILL PERFORM A STATISTICAL ANALYSIS, RECONCILING LIDAR ELEVATION COORDINATES WITH KNOWN CHECK POINT ELEVATIONS AND CORRESPONDING COORDINATE LOCATIONS. SANBORN WILL CALCULATE THE NVA AND VVA ACCURACIES OF THE LIDAR DATA AND DERIVATIVE PRODUCTS IN RMSEZ, 95  CONFIDENCE LEVEL AND 95TH PERCENTILES. THE RESULTS OF THIS ANALYSIS WILL BE REPORTED TO COUNTY IN APPROPRIATE ASPRS-SPECIFIED LANGUAGE IN THE VERTICAL ACCURACY SECTION OF THE AERIAL LIDAR REPORT AND WILL BE DOCUMENTED IN THE METADATA ACCORDINGLY.

PROJECT TITLE: KYFROMABOVE 2023 LIDAR ACQUISITIONPROJECT PERIOD: 06 29 2023 - 06 30 2025PROJECT ABSTRACT:KENTUCKY COMPLETED STATEWIDE LIDAR COVERAGE IN 2017 AND IS ACTIVELY WORKING TO COLLECT QL2 OR BETTER DATA IN AREAS THAT WERE COLLECTED MORE THAN 8 YEARS AGO OR MAY ONLY HAVE QL3 DATA. THE ONGOING KYFROMABOVE EFFORT HAS SECURED  1,510,000 FOR THE ACQUISITION OF QL2 LIDAR DURING 2023. THE AIM IS TO ACQUIRE NEW LIDAR DATA FOR 52 COUNTIES THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY CAPTURED IN THE 2010-2017 TIMEFRAME, DELIVERED IN AN EARLY LAS VERSION, AND THAT HAVE BEEN DESIGNATED HIGH-PRIORITY BY PROGRAM PARTNERS. IMPORTANTLY, THE 2023 AOI INCLUDES ALL COUNTIES THAT WERE IMPACTED BY THE HISTORIC FLOODING IN EASTERN KENTUCKY THIS PAST SUMMER. ALL PARTNERS UNDERSTAND THE IMPORTANCE OF ACQUIRING NEW LIDAR DATA TO CAPTURE THE POSTFLOOD LANDSCAPE. THE 2023 KYFROMABOVE AREAS OF INTEREST (AOI) CONSISTS OF TWO SEPARATE FOOTPRINTS COVERING 52 COUNTIES. THE FIRST COVERS 49 CONTIGUOUS COUNTIES LISTED ON PAGE THREE OF THIS APPLICATION. ALL COUNTIES HAVE BEEN DESIGNATED HIGH-PRIORITY BY FEMA, THE KENTUCKY DIVISION OF WATER (DOW), AND NRCS AND OTHER PROGRAM PARTNERS. THIS AREA IS CONTIGUOUS TO PREVIOUS KYFROMABOVE LIDAR AOIS AND INCLUDES COUNTIES THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY ACQUIRED IN THE 2010-2017 TIMEFRAME. THE AOI IS SITUATED IN EAST-CENTRAL KENTUCKY AND INCLUDES THE AREAS IMPACTED BY THE 2022 FLOODS. THE SECOND AOI CONTAINS JEFFERSON, OLDHAM, AND BULLITT COUNTIES WHICH ARE SITUATED IN CENTRAL KENTUCKY ALONG THE OHIO RIVER. ACQUISITION OF THESE COUNTIES WILL ENSURE THAT THEY MEET OR EXCEED THE REQUIRED SPECIFICATIONS. PREVIOUSLY, LIDAR DATA FOR THIS AOI WAS CONTRIBUTED TO THE KYFROMABOVE EFFORT BY LOJIC, THE GIS CONSORTIUM THAT COVERS THE LOUISVILLE METROPOLITAN AREA. NRCS INDICATES THEY ARE CONTRIBUTING  400,000 THROUGH AN IA FOR THE ACQUISITION OF LIDAR DATA. THEIR FOCUS IN THIS REGION IS REPLACING THE 2010, 2011, AND 2012 VINTAGE DATA. INTERAGENCY COOPERATION, ALONG WITH USGS BAA FUNDING FOR THE COUNTIES CONTIGUOUS TO THE NRCS AOI, WILL ALLOW FOR COMPLETE COVERAGE OF A LARGE FOOTPRINT IN EAST-CENTRAL KENTUCKY. THE DIVISION OF WATER WILL UTILIZE THE NEWLY COLLECTED LIDAR DATA TO IMPROVE FLOODPLAIN DELINEATIONS, PERFORM INUNDATIONS STUDIES, AND DAM BREACH ANALYSIS WITHIN THE AOI. NRCS LEVERAGES THE DATA FOR LAND ASSESSMENT, DRAINAGE DESIGN, DEVELOPMENT OF BEST LAND MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND OTHER AGRICULTURAL NEEDS. THE KENTUCKY TRANSPORTATION CABINET ROUTINELY UTILIZES LIDAR DATA IN THE PLANNING AND DESIGN PHASES OF MOST ALL TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS. OTHER USES INCLUDE INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT, HABITAT MODELING, ARCHEOLOGICAL INVESTIGATIONS, AND WATER WASTEWATER PLANNING. ALL COLLECTED DATA WILL BE SHARED ACROSS STATE GOVERNMENT AND IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN. THE KYFROMABOVE PROGRAM WILL RE-ACQUIRE LIDAR DATA FOR COUNTIES THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY COLLECTED DURING THE 2010-2017 TIMEFRAME. REACQUISITION OF DATA FOR THIS AREA WILL ENSURE THAT IT MEETS CURRENT QL2 SPECIFICATIONS. THE DATA WILL BE LEVERAGED BY THE KY DIVISION OF WATER, NRCS, KENTUCKY TRANSPORTATION CABINET, DANIEL BOONE NATIONAL FOREST AND 52 COUNTIES TO IMPROVE ANALYSIS, DESIGN, AND RESEARCH CONDUCTED WITHIN THE AOI S. ALL COLLECTED DATA WILL BE SHARED ACROSS STATE GOVERNMENT AND IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN WHERE IT BRINGS VALUE TO A WIDE ARRAY OF BUSINESS PROCESSES.

PROJECT TITLE: LAKE ONTARIO SHORELINE (PARTIAL) PROJECT PERIOD: JUNE 29, 2023 - JUNE 30, 2025PROJECT ABSTRACT: LIDAR AT USGS QUALITY LEVEL 2 WILL BE COLLECTED ALONG THE NEW YORK PORTION OF THE LAKE ONTARIO SHORELINE IN ORLEANS COUNTY AND FROM WAYNE COUNTY EAST THROUGH JEFFERSON COUNTY. COVERAGE CONTINUES ALONG THE SHORELINE OF THE STLAWRENCE RIVER IN JEFFERSON COUNTY AND MOST OF ST LAWRENCE COUNTY. COVERAGE EXTENDS INLAND TO INCLUDE ALL OF ORLEANS COUNTY AND PORTIONS OF CAYUGA, JEFFERSON, OSWEGO, ST. LAWRENCE AND WAYNE COUNTIES, TOTALING AROUND 2,337SQUARE MILES. ALL SIX COUNTIES HAVE SHORELINE ALONG LAKE ONTARIO WHICH IS A CRITICAL ECONOMIC AND ECOLOGICAL ASSET. THIS SHORELINE IS SUSCEPTIBLE TO NEGATIVE IMPACTS OF LAKE LEVEL RISE IN THE SPRINGTIME AND WAS UNDER A STATE OF EMERGENCY FROM MAY 20, 2019 THRU MAY 20, 2020. COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WOULD HAVE THE LAKE ONTARIO SHORELINE WITH DATA THAT IS 2019 OR NEWER. THIS WATERSHED IS AN IRREPLACEABLE NATURAL RESOURCE AND UP-TO-DATE GEOSPATIAL DATA IS AN EFFECTIVE TOOL IN PROTECTING IT. THIS PROJECT CONTINUES NEW YORK STATE S EFFORTS TO UPDATE STATEWIDE ELEVATION DATA VIA LIDAR COLLECTION IN COORDINATION WITH FEDERAL EFFORTS. THE PLANNED PROJECT WILL COVER ALL OR PARTS OF SIX COUNTIES (CAYUGA, JEFFERSON, ORLEANS, OSWEGO, ST. LAWRENCE AND WAYNE) IN NY ALONG THE LAKE ONTARIO SHORELINE, REPLACING PORTIONS OF TWO LIDAR-DERIVED DATASETS. ALL NEW COLLECTIONS WILL MEET QUALITY LEVEL 2 SPECIFICATIONS, AND ARE PLANNED TO BEGIN IN SPRING 2023.NYS PROPOSES TO COMPLETE THIS PROJECT USING THEIR CURENT CONTRACT WITH THE SANBORN MAP COMPANY. TO MAXIMIZE USE OF THE 2023 FLIGHT WINDOW, WE HAVE ALREADY BRIEFED SANBORN OF THE PLANNED PROJECT. ONCE 3DEP FUNDING IS APPROVED,WE WILL TASK SANBORN. NYS DATA REVIEW WILL USE THE SAME PROCESSES USED ON PREVIOUS ACCEPTED 3DEPLIDAR PROJECTS. BEFORE DATA COLLECTION, NYS REVIEWS THE FLIGHT PLANS FOR APPROPRIATE FLYING HEIGHT AND SWATH OVERLAP. SURVEY PLANS ARE REVIEWED TO ENSURE SUFFICIENT CONTROL AND CHECKPOINT DATA. DURING FLIGHT SEASON, THE CONTRACTOR AND NYS COMMUNICATE REGULARLY TO TRACK WEATHER AND GROUND CONDITIONS, EQUIPMENT STAGING, AND PROGRESS. NYS EXPECTS CONTIGUOUS AREAS TO BE COLLECTED. ALL DATA FEEDS (ABGPS, IMU, ETC.) ARE REVIEWED. FLIGHT AND GROUND SURVEY REPORTS ANDLIDAR SWATH DATA ARE REVIEWED NEXT. THE SWATH DATA IS REVIEWED FOR FULL COVERAGE PLUS ABSOLUTE AND RELATIVE SPATIAL ACCURACY. NYS COLLECTS INDEPENDENT QUALITY CONTROL DATA TO ENSURE SUFFICIENT SPATIAL AND LAND COVER-TYPE COVERAGE.ONCE THE CLASSIFIED POINT CLOUD IS REVIEWED, THE CONTRACTOR IS INFORMED OF ANY ISSUES. AFTER THE ISSUES ARE ADDRESSED, THE CONTRACTOR PRODUCES THE FINAL DEM DATASET AND METADATA. THE DEM SURFACE IS COMPARED TO CHECKPOINTS AND WITH THE TIN FROM THE POINT CLOUD. BRIDGE LOCATIONS ARE REVIEWED FOR CORRECT MODELING. NYS CREATES A REPORT DESCRIBING THE RESULTS OF OUR REVIEW PROCESS WHICH WILL BE PART OF THE DELIVERY TO USGS.

PROJECT TITLE: CENTRAL AND EAST TEXAS LIDAR UPDATESPROJECT PERIOD: 06 27 2023 - 06 30 2025PROJECT ABSTRACT:THE TEXAS NATURAL RESOURCES INFORMATION SYSTEM (TNRIS), A DIVISION OF THE TEXAS WATER DEVELOPMENT BOARD, IS SEEKING COST SHARE ASSISTANCE FOR THREE AREAS OF INTEREST (AOI) LOCATED IN NORTH AND CENTRAL TEXAS. TWDB IS SEEKING ADDITIONAL PARTNERSHIPS FROM LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES IN TEXAS TO ENSURE TEXAS MAINTAINS QL2 LIDAR DATA STATEWIDE. THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE THE COMPETITIVELY BID DEPARTMENT OF INFORMATION RESOURCES (DIR) GEOSPATIAL PRODUCTS AND SERVICES CONTRACT ADMINISTERED BY TNRIS, REFERRED TO AS THE TEXAS STRATEGIC MAPPING (STRATMAP). TNRIS WILL COMPETITIVELY BID THIS PROJECT IN LATE SUMMER 2023 AND HAVE THE DATA ACQUIRED IN LEAF OFF CONDITIONS IN TEXAS (DECEMBER23-MARCH24). TNRIS IS THE CENTRALIZED GIS ENTITY LEAD BY THE GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION OFFICER FOR THE STATE OF TEXAS AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING, DISTRIBUTING, AND COORDINATING DATA-COLLECTION FOR GEOSPATIAL DATA IN TEXAS. THE TNRIS STRATMAP PROGRAM HAS MANAGED AND ACQUIRED OVER 70,000 SQUARE MILES OF LIDAR, HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF SQUARE MILES OF HIGH RESOLUTION ORTHOIMAGERY, AND A MULTITUDE OF GEOSPATIAL LAYERS FOR TEXAS SINCE 2009 WHEN TNRIS BEGAN EARNESTLY COLLECTING LIDAR IN TEXAS THROUGH COOPERATIVE CONTRACTS.THE CENTRAL AND EAST TEXAS LIDAR UPDATE PROJECT WILL REPLACE OLD LIDAR DATA SETS CAPTURED 2014 OR PRIOR OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS. THE STRATMAP PROGRAM HAS SECURED AND GUARANTEED FUNDING FOR AN ESTIMATED 75  OF THE  6,090 SQUARE MILE PROJECT. BASED ON HISTORICAL PRICING THROUGH THE STRATMAP PROGRAM, THE COST TO ACQUIRE THE DATA IS ESTIMATED AT   1,000,000.00. THIS WOULD YIELD A TOTAL OF OVER 6,000 SQUARE MILES OF DATA THAT EXCEEDS QL2 STANDARDS AT A COST OF UNDER  45.00 PER SQUARE MILE TO THE USGS. TWDB IS SEEKING COST SHARE OF THE ENTIRE AREA OF INTEREST (AOI) TO ENABLE DATA CAPTURE THAT WILL ENSURE TEXAS MAINTAINS QL2 LIDAR QUALITY STATEWIDE. THE HUC BASED PROJECT BOUNDARIES OVERLAPS WITH AREAS WITHOUT CURRENT 3DEP QUALITY DATA IN ADDITION TO FEDERAL PRIORITY AOIS DEMONSTRATED BY THE USGS AND OSMRE. THIS PROJECT COVERS PORTIONS OF FOUR MAJOR RIVERS IN TEXAS (BRAZOS, COLORADO, WEST FORK TRINITY, AND SABINE) AND THEIR WATERSHEDS. IN ADDITION, THERE IS PARTIAL OR FULL COVERAGE OF 8 MAJOR RESERVOIRS AND LAKES. THE PROJECT AREA COVERS PORTIONS OF OVER 45 CITIES WITH A COMBINED POPULATION 340,880.LIDAR ACQUIRED FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED FOR FLOODPLAIN MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING, FEATURE EXTRACTION, WATER QUALITY MODELING, STREAM RESTORATION POTENTIAL ANALYSIS, CHANGE DETECTION, WILDFIRE MITIGATION, AND HABITAT IDENTIFICATION MODELING FOR ENDANGERED SPECIES.THE CENTRAL AND EAST TEXAS LIDAR UPDATE COVERS  6,090 SQUARE MILES OF AREAS IN CENTRAL AND EAST TEXAS WHERE LIDAR NO LONGER MEETS QL2 STANDARDS DUE TO QUALITY AND DATA COLLECTION DATE. THIS PROJECT COVERS PORTIONS OF FOUR MAJOR RIVERS IN TEXAS (BRAZOS, COLORADO, WEST FORK TRINITY, AND SABINE) AND THEIR WATERSHEDS. IN ADDITION, THERE IS PARTIAL OR FULL COVERAGE OF 8 MAJOR RESERVOIRS AND LAKES. THIS PROJECT WAS MANAGED BY THE TEXAS STRATEGIC MAPPING (STRATMAP) PROGRAM AND UTILIZED THE STRATMAP CONTRACTS HELD BY THE TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF INFORMATION RESOURCES (DIR).LIDAR ACQUIRED FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED FOR FLOODPLAIN MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING, FEATURE EXTRACTION, WATER QUALITY MODELING, STREAM RESTORATION POTENTIAL ANALYSIS, CHANGE DETECTION, WILDFIRE MITIGATION, AND HABITAT IDENTIFICATION MODELING FOR ENDANGERED SPECIES.

PROJECT TITLE: VERMONT 2023 STATEWIDE QL1PROJECT PERIOD: JUN 26, 2023 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2025PROJECT ABSTRACT:STATE OF VERMONT, VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION IS PROPOSING A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TO ACQUIRE QL1 INLAND TOPOGRAPHIC LIDAR FOR 9,649 SQUARE MILES COMPRISING THE ENTIRE STATE OF VERMONT. VERMONT SUCCESSFULLY PARTICIPATED IN 3DEP FROM 2013 - 2017 AND COMPLETED STATEWIDE QL2 LIDAR IN 2017, WHICH HAS BEEN A TREMENDOUS ASSET TO A GROWING NUMBER OF USERS. CURRENTLY, VERMONT S DATA IS AN AVERAGE OF 8 YEARS OLD AND LARGE PORTIONS OF THE DATASET ARE OUT OF DATE. LED BY THE VERMONT CENTER FOR GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION (VCGI) AND THE AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION, VERMONT WILL BUILD ON THE SUCCESS OF PAST PARTNERSHIPS TO MEET THE GROWING NEED FOR MORE RECENT ELEVATION DATA AT A HIGHER SPATIAL RESOLUTION. UNLIKE PREVIOUS EFFORTS, THE 2023 LIDAR ACQUISITION WILL COLLECT LIDAR FOR THE ENTIRE STATE IN A SINGLE YEAR. DOING SO WILL REDUCE COSTS THROUGH THE ECONOMIES OF SCALE AND REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ADMINISTRATIVE OVERHEAD NEEDED TO MANAGE THE HIGH NUMBER OF DELIVERABLES THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH MULTI-YEAR EFFORTS. THE NEW AND IMPROVED ELEVATION DATA WILL SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ACROSS ALL SECTORS OF VERMONT S STRATEGIC PLAN AND CORE FUNCTIONS THROUGHOUT GOVERNMENT - INCLUDING PUBLIC SAFETY, ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, WATER QUALITY, WATERSHED MANAGEMENT, GEOLOGY, TRANSPORTATION PLANNING, FOREST AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT, LOCAL PLANNING, AND FLOODPLAIN MANAGEMENT, AND MORE.THE VERMONT LIDAR PLAN HIGHLIGHTS SOME OF THE IMPACTFUL WORK THAT IS RELIANT UPON THE QL2 LIDAR DATA, PROVIDES A JUSTIFICATION FOR A NEW STATE WIDE QL1 ACQUISITION, AND OUTLINES THE MAINTENANCE AND DISTRIBUTION PLAN FOR THE RESULTING PRODUCTS. ALL LIDAR RELATED PRODUCTS WILL BE ADDED TO THE USGS 3DEP COLLECTION AND WILL BECOME PART OF THE VERMONT LIDAR PROGRAMS LIST OF CURATED ELEVATION ASSETS WHERE THEY WILL BE MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE THROUGH THE NATIONAL MAP AND THE VERMONT OPEN GEODATA PORTAL RESPECTIVELY AS WEB SERVICES, DIRECT DOWNLOADS, INTERACTIVE MAP VIEWERS, AND CUSTOMIZED WEB MAPPING APPLICATIONS.VCGI PROPOSES A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TO COLLECT 9,649 SQUARE MILES OF QL1 LIDAR DATA IN A SINGLE SEASON FOR THE ENTIRE STATE OF VERMONT. PRESENTLY, LARGE PORTIONS OF VERMONT S QL2 LIDAR DATASET ARE OUT OF DATE (  8 YEARS) AND STAKEHOLDERS HAVE EXPRESSED A DESIRE TO OBTAIN MORE RECENT ELEVATION DATA AT A HIGHER RESOLUTION. VERMONT HAS A HISTORY OF ENGAGING WITH PARTNERS TO ACQUIRE LIDAR DATA AND THIS PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE THE RELATIONSHIPS BUILT FROM PAST EXPERIENCES. THE RESULTING QL1 LIDAR PRODUCTS WILL BE MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE THROUGH THE NATIONAL MAP, USGS ENTWINE, AND THE VERMONT OPEN GEODATA PORTAL AS STREAMABLE SERVICES, DIRECT DOWNLOADS, IN INTERACTIVE MAP VIEWERS, AND IN CUSTOMIZED WEB MAPPING APPLICATIONS WHERE THEY CAN SERVE AN ABUNDANCE OF END USER NEEDS. VCGI INTENDS TO CONTRACT WITH SANBORN, INC. TO COLLECT AND PROCESS THE LIDAR DATA TO MEET THE USGS 3DEP LIDAR BASE SPECIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS FOR QL1 DATA. THE FOLLOWING ARE UNDERSTOOD TO BE THE BASIC REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS PROJECT:1) ACQUISITION AND POST-PROCESSING: NATIONAL GEOSPATIAL PROGRAM LIDAR BASE SPECIFICATION 2022, REVISION A AT QL1 WITH AN ANPS OF  0.35 METERS. 2) SPATIAL ACCURACY: RMSEZ  10 CM  NVA AT THE 95-PERCENT CONFIDENCE LEVEL  19.6 CM  VVA AT THE 95TH PERCENTILE  30 CM.3) HYDRO-FLATTENING: NATIONAL GEOSPATIAL PROGRAM LIDAR BASE SPECIFICATION 2022, REVISION A. 4) CLASSIFICATION SCHEME: NATIONAL GEOSPATIAL PROGRAM LIDAR BASE SPECIFICATION 2022, REVISION A. 5)FIELD TESTING: NON-VEGETATED VERTICAL ACCURACY (NVA) AND VEGETATED VERTICAL ACCURACY (VVA) CHECK POINTS REQUIRED. DELIVERABLES:1. CLASSIFIED POINT CLOUD2. BARE EARTH SURFACE (RASTER DEM)3. BREAKLINES4. INTENSITY IMAGES5. MAXIMUM HEIGHT SURFACE RASTERS6. SWATH SEPARATION IMAGES7. SWATH POLYGONS8. GROUND SURVEY9. LIDAR MAPPING REPORT10. METADATA11. PROJECT PILOT

PROJECT TITLE:LIDAR COLLECTION (QL2) OF ALL OR PART OF DUTCHESS, ORANGE, ROCKLAND AND ULSTER COUNTIES, NEW YORK COVERING OVER 3,200 SQUARE MILES.PROJECT PERIOD: 7/25/2022-4/30/2024AWARD PURPOSE-LIDAR AT USGS QUALITY LEVEL 2 WILL BE COLLECTED FOR ALL OF DUTCHESS, ORANGE, ROCKLAND, AND ULSTER COUNTIES IN NEW YORK STATE, COVERING AROUND 3209 SQUARE MILES. THIS PROJECT CONTINUES NEW YORK STATE'S EFFORTS TO UPDATE STATEWIDE ELEVATION DATA VIA LIDAR COLLECTION IN COORDINATION WITH FEDERAL EFFORTS. WE HAVE SELECTED THE PROJECT AREAS FOLLOWING DISCUSSIONS WITH FEMA, USDA-NRCS AND USGS ABOUT IN-PROGRESS AND PLANNED FEDERAL LIDAR COLLECTIONS. PROJECT EXTENTS WILL INCLUDE OVERLAP WITH THESE EXISTING PROJECTS TO ENSURE NO GAPS AND TO ALLOW FOR COMPARISONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED-COLLECT, REVIEW, AND DISTRIBUTE QUALITY LEVEL 2 LIDAR DATA FOR ALL OR PART OF DUTCHESS, ORANGE, ROCKLAND, AND ULSTER COUNTIES. DATA COLLECTED WILL MEET THE LATEST USGS LIDAR SPECIFICATIONS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES -BARE EARTH DEM, HYDRO BREAKLINES, CLASSIFIED POINT CLOUD, METADATA, AND SUPPLEMENTAL SHAPEFILES THAT SUPPORT THE PROJECT.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)-STATE, FEDERAL, AND MUNICIPAL AGENCIES AS WELL AS PRIVATE FIRMS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

PROJECT TITLE:EXPAND 3DEP COVERAGE IN OREGON BY 2,462 SQUARE MILES WHILE AIDING POST-WILDFIRE RECOVERY WORK BY STATE AND  FEDERAL AGENCIESPROJECT PERIOD: 06/01/2022-05/31/2024LIGHT DETECTION AND RANGING (LIDAR) IS AN ACTIVE REMOTE-SENSING TECHNOLOGY THAT PROVIDES HIGH-PRECISION MODELS OF THREE-DIMENSIONAL OBJECTS ON EARTH'S SURFACE. IN FORESTRY, LIDAR DATA PROVIDE CRITICAL INFORMATION FOR A VARIETY OF KEY NATURAL RESOURCE CONSIDERATIONS, INCLUDING GEOLOGIC HAZARD DETECTION, WATERSHED ANALYSIS, AND FOREST INVENTORY. THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY'S STATE FOREST DIVISION MANAGES APPROXIMATELY 1,164 SQUARE MILES OF PUBLICLY-OWNED FORESTS IN OREGON. THE DIVISION OPERATES UNDER A STATUTORY MANDATE TO MANAGE THESE FORESTS FOR THE "GREATEST PERMANENT VALUE," WHICH PROVIDES ECONOMIC, SOCIAL, AND ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS TO THE PEOPLE OF OREGON. WITH ADVANCES IN LIDAR TECHNOLOGY, THE STATE FOREST DIVISION IS DEVELOPING A NEW FOREST INVENTORY BASED ON REMOTELY-SENSED DATA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO (1) UPGRADE 1,393 SQUARE MILES OF STATE FORESTS LIDAR INVENTORY TO SHARE WITH THE 3DEP NATIONAL MAP, (2) COLLECT NEW LIDAR ON 149 SQUARE MILES OF STATE FORESTS, AND (3) COLLECT NEW LIDAR ACROSS NEARLY 625 SQUARE MILES WITHIN THE FOOTPRINT OF THE 2020 LABOR DAY FIRES TO HELP POST-FIRE RECOVERY ACROSS LAND OWNERSHIPS. THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY WILL USE THESE DATA TO INFORM AGENCY DECISION REGARDING HABITAT CONSERVATION, TIMBER MANAGEMENT, SILVICULTURAL PRESCRIPTIONS, GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, AND WATERSHED RESTORATION. SUCH DETAILED DATA ARE INVALUABLE FOR THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY IN ITS EFFORTS TO PROVIDE THE GREATEST PERMANENT VALUE FROM STATE FORESTS TO OREGONIANS. DELIVERABLES TO THE AGENCY AND ITS STAKEHOLDERS WILL INCLUDE FOREST INVENTORY AND CARBON MAPS, DIGITAL ELEVATION MODELS, AND HILLSHADE RELIEF BASEMAPS OF THE LIDAR ACQUISITIONS. FURTHERMORE, THE NEW LIDAR ACQUISITION TARGETS THE AFTERMATH OF THE BEACHIE CREEK AND LIONSHEAD FIRES THAT JOINTLY BURNED MORE THAN 400,000 ACRES DURING THE LABOR DAY FIRES OF 2020 ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL, AND PRIVATE OWNERSHIPS. THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY WILL SHARE THESE DATA DIRECTLY WITH PARTNER AGENCIES AND THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGIC SURVERY'S THREE DIMENSIONAL ELEVATION PROGRAM DATABASE WILL MAKE THE DATA PUBLICLY-AVAILABLE. EXPANDED AND TIMELY LIDAR DATA WILL PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION ON POTENTIAL LANDSLIDE RISK, POST-FIRE FOREST CONDITIONS, AND WATERSHED DYNAMICS TO AGENCIES, SCIENTISTS, NON-PROFITS, AND DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS AFFECTED BY THESE FIRES.

PROJECT TITLE:DOGAMI OLC MALHEUR 3DEP 2022 PROJECTPROJECT PERIOD: 6/1/2022-5/31/2024THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL INDUSTRIES (DOGAMI) HAS BEEN FUNDED BY THE USGS 3DEP PROGRAM FOR A NEW OREGON LIDAR CONSORTIUM (OLC) LIDAR COLLECTION, TITLED DOGAMI OLC MALHEUR 2022 3DEP LIDAR PROJECT. THIS PROJECT WILL ACQUIRE ~ 926 SQUARE MILES OF NEW QL1 3DEP COMPLIANT LIDAR DATA IN MALHEUR COUNTY, LOCATED IN EASTERN OREGON. DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE HYDRO-FLATTENED BARE EARTH, HIGHEST HIT, AND INTENSITY RASTERS, AS WELL AS CLASSIFIED POINT CLOUD DATA, PROJECT VECTOR DATA, SURVEY DATA, HYDRO BREAK-LINE DATA, AND A SURVEY REPORT. THE FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO BE USED TO HYDRO-FLATTEN A RECENTLY COLLECTED LIDAR DATASET, THE DOGAMI OLC UMATILLA 2020 LIDAR PROJECT, TO MEET CURRENT 3DEP SPECIFICATIONS. THE COLLECTION AREA INCLUDES PARTS OF THE POWDER RIVER, MALHEUR RIVER, BULLY CREEK, AND WILLOW CREEK WATERSHEDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO BE ADJACENT TO THE RECENTLY FUNDED DOGAMI BAKER COUNTY 2021 FEMA CTP QL1 LIDAR PROJECT AND PROVIDE COVERAGE FOR NORTHERN MALHEUR COUNTY FOR THE FIRST TIME. THE PROJECT AREA OVERLAPS WITH USGS, BLM, FEMA, AND USACE FEDERAL PRIORITY SHAPEFILES FOR OREGON, AND WILL ACQUIRE LIDAR OVER AREAS OF INTEREST FOR THE CURRENT USGS AND BLM ABANDONED MINES PROJECT. THE ELEVATION DATA COLLECTED BY THIS PROJECT CAN BE USED AT ALL LEVELS OF GOVERNMENT TO CHARACTERIZE AND MANAGE NATURAL RESOURCES AND HAZARDS AND ASSIST WITH LAND-USE PLANNING OBJECTIVES. THIS DATA WILL ALSO BE INCORPORATED INTO THE CURRENT USGS 1-METER NATIONAL ELEVATION MAP TO INCREASE OVERALL ELEVATION DATA COVERAGE FOR THE NATION.

AWARD PURPOSE: DOUGLAS COUNTY, MINNESOTA, DESIRES AN IMPROVED DATA SET TO INCREASE ACCURACY, AND BRING IT UP TO UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SERVICES (USGS) QL1 STANDARDS AS THE WHOLE STATE.WILL RECEIVE HYDROLOGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL INFORMATION ON THE 350 LAKES IN OUR COUNTY. THE HIGHER DENSITY AND GREATER ACCURACY DATASETS WILL SERVE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR FIVE TO TEN YEARS. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, AND LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS, PREFER WORKING WITH A LOCAL PROVIDER.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 95 WEST IS THE PROVIDER THAT WILL COLLECT THE DATA THIS SPRING. AFTER PROCESSING, THEY WILL CREATE BASE DELIVERABLES AS PER USGS 3DEP REQUIREMENTS. 95 WEST FULLY UNDERSTANDS THE ACTIVITIES, DELIVERABLES AND TIMELINE REQUIRED (I.E. BARE EARTH MODELS IN LAS V1.4, HYDRO-BREAKLINES IN ESRI GEODATABASE FORMAT, QA/QC REPORTS, FGDC COMPLIANT METADATA, ETC.).DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:- STORMWATER MODELING- FLOOD MITIGATION- WATERSHED MODELING- LAKE QUALITY ENHANCEMENTS- SHORELINE RESTORATION PROJECTS- ROAD CONSTRUCTION DESIGN- COUNTY DRAIN TILE AND CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT- TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AND ROW ACQUISITION- COUNTY DITCH SYSTEM MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR- PARK REPAIRS AND LAND ACQUISITION- PLANNING/ZONING SITE REVIEWS- AIRPORT SAFETY REVIEW- SURVEY FOR UNSAFE WORK ZONES- RENEWABLE-ENERGY OPPORTUNITIES AND STUDIES- ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION LINE CORRIDOR REVIEWTHE EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL HELP US BETTER MANAGE THE COUNTY DITCH SYSTEM AND ASSIST IN GREATER POINT DENSITY FOR FUTURE PLANNING AND DESIGN MAPPING. IT WILL ASSIST WITH ACQUISITION PLANNING INCLUDING FUTURE TRANSPORTATION AND ACQUIRING LAND FOR A PARK THAT IS NEAR A BODY OF WATER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:- FEDERAL GOVERNMENT- STATE OF MINNESOTA- DOUGLAS COUNTY- MULTIPLE CITIES IN THE COUNTY INCLUDING ALEXANDRIA, CARLOS, MILTONA, GARFIELD, BRANDON, EVANSVILLE, KENSINGTON, NELSON, OSAKIS, AND FORADA- MULTIPLE TOWNSHIPS IN THE COUNTY- LAND SURVEYORS AND CIVIL ENGINEERS- GENERAL PUBLICTHE LOCAL SPONSORS THAT WILL BENEFIT ARE ALEXANDRIA LIGHT AND POWER (ALP), ALEXANDRIA LAKE AREA SANITARY DISTRICT (ALASD), OTTER TAIL POWER COMPANY AND THE RUNESTONE ELECTRIC ASSOCIATION (REA) COOPERATIVE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: DOUGLAS COUNTY, MINNESOTA, WILL WORK ON SETTING TARGETS, STATIC GPS ON 30 POINTS IN THE COUNTY AND ESTABLISH ADDITIONAL TEST POINTS, AS NEEDED, FOR THIS PROJECT.
